column5: Dave, i will be thinking about you, and waiting for news. Be strong
Hang in there Dave. Our thoughts are with you. I've been there many times and know what you are going through.
and again...
Good luck to her!!!
Wishing you all the best for a good outcome today! Keep us posted!
Yes, please do.
Waiting is hard...I'm pacing the hospital with my old man. He's not doing well, but being in the hospital where he worked for 25 yrs is keeping him busy. It seems like he knows everyone who walks by!
hoping for a 100% recovery for your mom, stay strong for your parents
thinking positive thoughts for all of you.
So Dave, how is she, and how are you and your Pops.
Keep us posted Dave.  My thoughts are with you and your family.
all the best wishes dave !!! i hope everything will be alright,stay positive !!
Good thoughts coming your way bud, stay positive.

Well, as far as I know the surgery went well. We don't know the outcome yet because the doctor never talked to us and even if he did he wouldn't be able to tell us if he got everything without further testing.  Mom is doing well, she is in a lot of pain and is very nautious. We're not sure if it is from the anesthetics or from the morphine she was given after the surgery. Either way she wasn't feeling well when we brought her home yesterday. As for my dad,well, god help him lol. I love my dad to death but the man is kind of useless when it comes to taking care of himself or my mom. So, I've taken the next few days of work off to take care of my mom and babysit my dad lol.  Hopefully she slept well last night because I know I didn't lol$
Glad the surgery went well
fingers crossed that the days ahead bring very good news for your mom
Dave, Two weeks ago we had dinner with a couple. She is a 15 year breast cancer survivor. Years ago the prognosis was dismal but today it is much better.  Prayers for you all!
Good thoughts for you and your family! hopefully they got it all!
Nice to know that the surgery went well. Thanks for the update, positive thoughts your way.

I'm sure no matter how crappy your mom feels, she's happy to be home, and to have you around for a few days to keep her company.  Good on ya.  Best Wishes for a speedy complete recovery.  My grandmother is 82, and has survived two rounds of cancer both over 20 years ago.
The fact that she's home would suggest (I hope) that things went very well.

Yes, her surgery went well. We brought her home yesterday afternoon and she was in rough shape. She was very nautious from the anesthetic and morphine. I stayed with them until late last night. So needless to say I didn't get much sleep because my dad being an old fashion dad, can't really take care of himself.  This morning I woke up and helped get my kids ready for school and headed over there. When I showed up my mom was a different person. She was up and about feeling better but still in pain. So I helped out at their place, but man, I forgot how boring it was there lol.  Thanks for the support guys! She has to wait a week for the results from her lymph nodes to see if the cancer has spread.

I forgot to add that the home care nurse came this morning. After changing the bandages she said mom wasn't drain much and that she is healing well. Surprisingly, she had no stitches, they used some sort of glue!
My thoughts go out to your mom and dad, she will be better in no time.
I'm sorry to here that Dave. She will be in our thoughts and prayers..

Dave, My mother went through this in 2008. She had all the treatments and a masectomy. When her hair grew back WHITE, she decided to leave it like that and never colour it again. It was a bigger shock to us then the surgery. She is happy and healthy now (she's 65). Pictured with my neices and nephews.        My mom is a very strong person and she struggled. BUT with family support she will make it through this. My thoughts are with you. Blair

Positive thoughts sent your way Dave  Cancer is never a good thing, but if there is one thing to remember, it's that your mum found out about it and she can take the necessary steps towards recovery.  Stay positive, have hope and have a good sense of humor...They all go a long way
Good luck man. I have had 3 family members survive in the past 2 years. Keeping her positive is half the battle.
Everday will bring new hope... my thoughts and prayers go to you and yours...
Your mother will be in my prayers. Stay strong and hope for the best.
Your family will be in the thoughts and prayers of our family, Dave..Sorry to hear the bad news...
It's scary times when a loved one is ill. Don't give up hope though and stay positive. My thoughts and prayers are with ya.

No body wants to hear that "C" word but when we do we need to control it not let it control us, stay positive & try to keep your family positive, it does go a long way, take all the positive energy you need from here, keep your chin up & drive on, SBK
I will pray for your family and pray that all goes well.
Consider it done Dave. Let's hope for the best!

On their way to you and your family. As many have said here - the power of positive thougths cannot be underestimated. They have come a looooong way in sucessfully treating this form of cancer - a co worker was diagnosed with it this spring - had treatments, masectomy and is now 100% free, all in less than 8 months.  It can be beaten.

Our thoughts and prayers sent up for your mom and you...  Been through this with my mom and wife...  Maribeth walked 5Kms with many survivors in the CIBC P'boro walk 2nd Oct 2011 as she has done for many years now...
A lot of breast cancer survivors around us, face it, will all be OK. Good luck!
Prayers from our family to yours.
My best wishes to both of them Dave. Let's hope your father can keep it all together and holds up under the pressure and the surgury all turns out better than A1.
Thanks everyone for your positive thoughts, my mom is doing well, but feeling a lot of pain and discomfort...
Just back from a long camping trip.  Your mom will be in my thoughts.  Good luck man.
You mother is in our POSITIVE Thoughts and Prayers. With modern medicine she will have a very fast recovery.  Bob
Prayers sent!!! Stay strong Brother!!

Well, today is my moms surgery. I'm writing this in the day surgery waiting room. My mom seems to be in good spirits but my dad is a nervous wreck. I'm holding on, but I'm confident everything will go alright.  Fingers crossed!
Hang tough. Look after Dad and all will work out fine.
My best wishes to everyone for today
Be strong. Hope everything works out for your mom.
Dave, please extend my best wishes to your Mom

Well, I got a call yesterday and I found out that my mother has breast cancer. The doctor found a small mass and a biopsy confirmed that it was cancerous.  She and the doctors have no idea how far along the cancer is or if it has spread. She is scheduled for surgery in November. I haven't seen my mother cry so much since my grandmother died almost 20 yrs ago. She's a strong woman, but I don't know if she can handle this. My father is also a wreck and with his heart I'm worried he'll have a heart attack.  Anyways, I'm wondering if everyone could say a prayer or send positve thoughts her way.  Thanks all  Dave
Hoping and Praying for You all FNA--All The Best
Consider it done. Be strong for them Dave, your parents will need a shoulder to lean on.
Thoughts and prayers your way Dave.  Breast cancer has a VERY high survival rate...so try and be the positive influence during the chaos...
Good thoughts coming to your family from mine Dave
and done again.

Our thoughts are with you for sure. Dave, I know what you are going through, I took my mother to the hospital last Feb 14, Had never been seriously sick in her life (90) Except for a broken leg. In six weeks we lost her. I have a sister in law who is five years free of the it. All will work out well. There is so much they can do now.  A

My grandfathers girlfriend was diagnosed and finished all treatment approx. 8mnths ago. She is completely cancer-free now and doing very well! Keep focusing on the positive outcome that could be your Mom's.  If she hasn't already, have your Mom watch The Secret. There is a great part in there for her. In times like this, it doesn't matter how "out there" believing in something may seem, if there is even a slight chance it might work, it's worth a shot!  All the best thoughts and hopes to you and your parents Dave.
Thoughts and good wishes on their way.
Thoughts and prayers for your mom and dd F&A
and again!
Dave, consider it done.And one for you too.   Paul
from me as well and I'm crossing fingers, legs and anything else that will help your mom kick the C to the curb.

When you are given the "C" word (i speak from life) you just want to curl up and cry . But as someone who has so far , not given in , lots of new treatments lots of hope . Im still here and I hope she will allso do well , just stand with her and good things will come . My prayers go out to you and yours.
No problem. I'll say a prayer for your mom, man.
Positive thoughts coming your way Dave.

Positive thoughts for you and your family Dave.  Moms are stronger than you think, don't forget that.  She raised you right? I bet that was no easy task!  Hope all is well and please keep us updated.  Joey
The LORD is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit. Psalm 34:18.....will keep you in my prayers
Powerful thoughts and prayers sent to yer mom Dave. Stay strong,stay positive.
Done. Hope for the best.
thoughts and prayers Dave
we will be thinking of her here at my house.
Our thoughts and prayers are with you and your family!

I know what your going through Dave. I went through the same thing with my mom 4 yrs ago. My mom had a mesectomy done and has been cancer free ever since. She is 75 yrs old and had a choice of removing the breast or just the affected area. She was told there would be a better chance of getting all of it if the breast was removed. She said I don't need em anymore so take it all off. There was no doubt in her mind or mine that she would make a full recovery. Stay positive and I will say aprayer for your mom as well.
Good Lord willing. that dark cloud will soon depart. I hope all will be well in the end.
